p: Eventually, public health systems and governments were able to contain the outbreak and bring it to a close. The World Health Organization (WHO) reported 8422 cases of SARS worldwide, spread out among 32 countries. They reported 916 deaths from the virus, with a fatality rate of 10–15% [ 1]. A recent report in JAMA also suggested a 10% fatality rate and estimated that 20–30% of infected patients required mechanical ventilation [ 2]. As expected, the fatality rate was higher among the aged and those with comorbidities. Perhaps most importantly, the SARS outbreak showed that animal coronaviruses could spread to humans.
